paper_abstract: There are close relationships between three popular approaches to image thresholding, namely Ridler and Calvard's iterative-selection (IS) method, Kittler and Illingworth's minimum-error-thresholding (MET) method and Otsu's method. The relationships can be briefly described as: the IS method is an iterative version of Otsu's method; Otsu's method can be regarded as a special case of the MET method. The purpose of this correspondence is to provide a comprehensive clarification, some practical implications and further discussions of these relationships. (C) 2012 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Ridler and Calvard's, Kittler and Illingworth's and Otsu's methods for image thresholding
